body: Same with me, i use `ctrl + q` for tmux prefix

Same here with macOS 10.12.6
@aioutecism 's solution did work for me.

Same problem macOS 10.13.4 @aioutecism's fix also did not work for me.

I bisected the problem and it seems to have been introduced in 765949f256aefcc513d0bfb46b64d315f9c2f3d2

```
765949f256aefcc513d0bfb46b64d315f9c2f3d2 is the first bad commit
commit 765949f256aefcc513d0bfb46b64d315f9c2f3d2
Author: Francesca Frangipane <francesca@comfysoft.net>
Date:   Mon May 14 23:21:06 2018 -0400

    Update to glutin 0.16.0

    Note that `WM_CLASS` is now set to `"alacritty", "Alacritty"`
    instead of the previous value of `"Alacritty", "Alacritty"`. This
    seems to be more standard.

    This also contains some revised recommendations for installing the
    `.desktop` file.

:100755 000000 8f9be053ba6cc6a3bf3c50584aec58a9fa03dee9 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 D      Alacritty.desktop
:100644 100644 6a52043dc5df2c0ba0ca0b759700837debca83a4 0af2d395fb4fa26f742b00113f679d90b837de1c M      Cargo.lock
:100644 100644 645264d1ff0532fe64649dedb39bcd05c56f0cdb 2489c61c82dd9a4fc569e03d4f337e99d4d6ff02 M      Cargo.toml
:100644 100644 5c6eccdddd131573ef4a1b9bef741d44939ca75f e761c64d3d214e114757e99ab42938e2fd61a8c1 M      README.md
:000000 100644 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 8f9be053ba6cc6a3bf3c50584aec58a9fa03dee9 A      alacritty.desktop
:040000 040000 3599ad54543ab298fce46b349d34ba265b923b18 561511b0632926d86d8dcaff654b18496bf2b2e4 M      src
```
Same problem here after just upgrading to newest version of Alacritty.

Same problem for me on maxOS 10.13.6 with Alacritty(master branch b41c6b736d67d61e92b174dfea58ae46813934cd) above v0.2.1
```sh
- { key: Q, mods: Control, chars: "\x11" }
```
solved my problem
Same issue on v0.2.5 and Mac 10.14.2.  Solution posted by @aioutecism / @LittleKey works around the issue.

Same issue on v0.2.8 and Mac 10.14.3 .
Thanks works around.

issue.title: Vim <C-q> commands not recognized
issue.body:
Which operating system does the issue occur on?
MacOS Mojave 10.14.5

Issue:
I have keybinds in vim that let me close with ctrl+q,q:

```vim
inoremap <C-q>q <esc>:q!<cr>
nnoremap <C-q>q :q!<cr>
```

When using alacritty and vim (with or without tmux) I am unable to use this command.
When using Terminal.app and vim (with or without tmux), this command works fine.

Interestingly, 
```vim
inoremap <C-u>q <esc>:q!<cr>
nnoremap <C-u>q :q!<cr>
```

works as expected. The only thing I can find in my alacritty.yml file is `key: q, mods: Command`, which I don't expect to interact. Can you think of anything that would be causing this?

Edit: I have `stty -ixon` in my `.bashrc` which I expect to be able to let me use C-q

body:
Issue persists on v0.3.3 and Mac 10.14.5

Work around solves the issue.
Can someone share the output of `alacritty --print-events` up until the point the ctrl+q keys are pressed?
Do you have another binding for Ctrl+Q in your config? In the 'broken' case it's already sending a `ReceivedChar('\u{11}')`, so it seems like it should be working properly.

@jeremydr2 Wait, so you're saying only the second ctrl+q works? Do you release both q **and** control when pressing it twice?

It looks like you're pressing RControl, have you tried using LControl?

issue.title: MacOS not sending ReceivedCharacter event

labels.name: C - needs investigation
labels.description: Issue must be confirmed and researched
